document_data.mainbody:
Metastakixx was a strange creature that was created as a sentient guardian untold millennia before the 14 century DR by a forgotten deity.
thumb|The interior of Metastakixxs prison.|260x260px
thumb|The prisons exterior.|260x260px
Metastakixx was a mysterious and alien creature wrapped in a humanoid and somewhat feminine winged form. Their skin was a chrome-like mirror, and their body was shrouded in glowing light, worn like clothes. Metastakixx stood in the middle of the temple, unmoving like a metallic statue with intelligence sparking from behind their cloudy eyes.
Those who saw Metastakixx struggled with keeping their eyes on the creature, finding the winged form hard to comprehend, as if subconsciously making a discussion not to risk looking at their reflective shape for too long. Observers of the strange statuesque being felt an uncontrollable, overwhelming sorrow as if their hearts wept. When they spoke, they radiated waves of sadness and melancholy.
thumb|One of Metastakixxs strange forms, wrapped in shimmering glowing cloth.|340x340px
Metastakixxs mind was affected by their unknowable age and seeming constant pain. They could not speak easily as each word was a tremendous raspy-sounding effort. When Metastakixx had enough strength to try and remember anything, it was clear that everything in the creatures memory was gone, if it ever was there. Metastakixx did show signs of sentience and desire to know that or who they were and hoped to one day find out. The creature did not know of the "world." They have never seen what lies outside of their prison.
The temple where Metastakixx stood was hidden in an ancient cave deep in the cliffs of the Crabs Claw Coast. The small domed temple rose from behind an ancient ornamental gate in a flooded cavern on an island. The chamber was filled with shadow-like mists. Unknown to all but the guardian, the mists were Fragments of a Corrupt God, a form of primordial evil suspended in a temporary form to be sealed away and rendered harmless. The shadows were kept in a harmless state by strange floating globes – Mirrored Vaporizers that projected rays of red light up towards the temples dome.
The hidden temple held several artifacts that held echoes of the lost gods. The Last Remaining Pillar was a column that radiated old memories. When touched, bygone echoes of indeterminate gender sounded directionless in ones mind. The voice whispered, "Sssshhhhhh, we are sleeeeeeping...", then another voice joined in, joined by another, until it was a mental roar "Dont  lissssten, free usss, desssstroy them!"
Strange Sea Creature Statues decorated the temple. The creatures had some resemblance to dolphins but were somehow different, making it apparent that the depicted creatures were likely long lost to the world. Like other things in the temple, the "dolphins" projected a mental message "Whisperers in the darkness. Ancient evil. Hideous hissing. Violence unchained. Peaceful shores under a silver sky. So it shall be, so has it has ever been."
A strange ancient artifact, the Dreamstone, that dated back to the goddess Mystryl, could be found on the temples floor, possibly a remnant of some unfortunate soul trapped in the temple.
Lastly, the creatures shimmering glowing clothes were an enchanted cloak - the unique Cloak of Mists.
Metastakixx remembered almost nothing from their past apart from the name of a single being destined to release them from the unending sentry duty. The mirror figure did not remember how they knew of that person, nor did they ever wonder how they knew that name. Without Metastakixx and the destined individual knowing it, in some strange way, theyve always loved each other, long before one was born and long after the other lost all of their memory.
Everything about Metastakixx was a mystery. They knew that they were not born nor trapped in the lost chamber. Instead, Metastakixx was created inside the prison and tasked with the sentry duty over Fragments of a Corrupt God. It was unknown if Metastakixx was a woman, despite their feminine shape, and it was unknown if they were created to be sentient or if the sentience was developed over the course of countless centuries Metastakixx stood guard. "Forever" by their own accord.
Metastakixx waited for their creators to return, but they never did. The winged being stood guard, unmoving as centuries passed. Memories of who and what the masters were became clouded and then forgotten, just like the world around the temple forgot the creators. Memories disappeared one after the other until nothing remained in Metastakixxs mind but the sentry duty and the name of one individual not yet born.
Occasionally, moments of lucidity sparked in Metastakixxs mind, and they remembered ancient evil–shadows that came to swallow everything. Metastakixxs maker was in danger, and the sentry sealed the shadows, these  Fragments of a Corrupt God. The mirror being was tasked with keeping the shadows sealed in the hidden prison until the makes returned. They never did.
In the late 14 century DR, an ancient key that unlocked the gates to Metastakixxs lost temple could be found in a pile of junk in Torleths Treasures curio store in the hamlet of Gillians Hill.
Those who entered Metastakixxs chamber became trapped by the creature. The temple became sealed off until the mirrored being was released from their infinite task or the trapped Fragments of a Corrupt God were secured from being unleashed on the world. Metastakixx waited for the individual whose name was etched in their mind, the one who could defeat the shadows and help Metastakixx fulfill their purpose.
Unbeknown to Metastakixx, keeping the shadows imprisoned was the only thing, the only purpose, that sustained the winged guardians life. If released, Metastakixx died, possibly due to expending all of their strength over the millennia or because the magical prison and Metastakixx were one and the same. The individual whose name Metastakixx remembered was destined to release them, leaving the savior swallowed by sadness and grief, crying over Metastakixxs lifeless body.
